conbody.p: These panics are only raised in debug builds and are caused when the heap debugging functions detect a memory leak.

p.codeph: ALLOC COUNT 1 Expected aaaa Allocated bbbb Ln: ccc ddddd

entry.p: This panic is raised by RHeap::DbgMarkCheck() and User::DbgMarkCheck() when the current number of allocated heap cells is not as expected.
aaa is the expected number of heap cells.
bbb is the allocated number of heap cells.
ccc is a line number; typically the source statement line containing the call to User::DbgMarkCheck().
ddddd is a file name; typically the file containing the source statement containing the call to User::DbgMarkCheck().
